The 'Yankauer suction tip' (pronounced yangÂ´kow-
er) http://www.mercksource.com/pp/us/cns/cns_hl_dorlands_split.jsp?pg=/ppdo-
cs/us/common/dorlands/dorland/nine/100004025.htm is an oral suctioning
tool used in medical procedures. It is typically a firm plastic suction tip with
a large opening surrounded by a bulbous head and is designed to allow effective
suction without damaging surrounding tissue. This tool is used to suction
oropharyngeal secretions in order to prevent aspiration. A yankauer can also be
used to clear operative sites during surgical procedures and its suctioned
volume counted as blood loss during surgery.

Developed circa 1907 by Dr. Sidney Yankauer (1872-1932), the Yankauer Suction
Instrument has become the most common suction instrument in the world.
